There were no other sightings in Chalmette on or around October 28th 1971
Summary: watched rise from marsh, hover, then speed away at an amazing velocity
divs: Sighting Detailsoctober 28, 1971 while waiting for the boat launch to open so i could go fishing, i noticed a glow in the marsh just across the bayou (bienvenue). i thought the marsh was on fire, but it wasn't. the glowing object rose to about 100 or so feet and hovered there for several minutes. the object had a metalic appearance in the color of silvery blue. there was no noise coming from the object. the outter rim of the disc at it's middle changed colors from a gold to blue to red at random moments. the disc stood quite motionless and never wobbled. after approximately 15 minutes, the disc sped upward and north toward lake pontchatrain which was only about 4 miles away. its' speed was incredible, something i have never seen before and it came to a standstill over the lake as quickly as it had sped away from the marsh. after a couple of minutes the disc again sped away moving upward and toward the west until it was out of sight. i have always been a skeptic of u.f.o. s and until that moment i was. there is no doubt in my mind that the disc was vehicle that was being controlled by someone or something. it was also far more advanced than anything we or any other country have. i didn't see any little green men or any other color, but i know what i saw and i know it was real. i was fully awake, sober and not in the least interested in seeing anything other than fish. there are times when i wish i had never seeen the disc. people tend to ridicule things they don't understand or accept. there are also many times when i am grateful for the opportunity. i have become a more open minded individual, not so easy to reject what others might have knowledge of. i feel a part of a much larger universe than the one i knew before the sighting and that's a good feeling, a belonging feeling. we have much to learn from whom ever these visitors are. i hope that one day they will share their knowledge so that perhaps my grandchildren or their children might share in the wealth they have to offer. thanks for listening
